help-format.help:
Templates can contain the following patterns: 
	{undone}: number of tasks that are not completed yet
	{unarchived}: number of tasks that are not archived yet

If you surround an expression with pipe characters (|), the pattern will be mathematically evaluated after the replacements have been done.
For example: '{unarchived}-{undone}' will render as '3-2' for 3 unarchived and 2 undone tasks, but '|{unarchived}-{undone}| will render as '1'


You can also use a prefix to pad a number.
The prefix consists of three elements:
	A number indicating the desired width. If the number is wider, no padding will be done
	A letter indicating the padding direction:
		l: Pad left
		r: Pad right
		L: Pad at both sides, but more at left side if uneven padding
		R: Pad at both sides, but more at right side if uneven padding
	The character to pad with (optional, default is a space)
	A ':' to split the prefix and the wildcard

Examples:
	{3lx:undone} will render as xx2 for 2 undone tasks
	{4R0:unarchived} will render as 0300 if there are 3 unarchived tasks

help-hide.help: Note that padding and | cannot be used for the zero-matching pattern

help-hidden-pattern.help:

show-status-icon.help: If this is true, an icon will be shown in the top bar

display-format-string.help: Template that determines what is displayed in the top bar

hide-if-pattern-zero.help: If the specified pattern is zero, the elements specified here will be hidden

hide-pattern.help: If this template evaluates to zero, the top bar element will be hidden. Shortcuts still work.

style-priorities.summary: Whether tasks should be styled according to their priority
style-priorities.help: Whether tasks with a certain priority are shown in a specific style

priority-on-done.help: What should be done with the priority of a task when that task is completed

order-by-priority.summary: Should the elements be ordered by their priority?
order-by-priority.help: Whether the tasks with a higher priority should be shown higher up in the list or the order should be left as in the todo.txt file

only-show-priority-above.summary: Only show tasks with a priority of or above
only-show-priority-above.human_name: Only show tasks with a priority of or above
only-show-priority-above.help: Only show tasks with a given or higher priority. Leave empty to show all tasks.
